reviewText: There's Betty Boop and then there's Betty Boop!  The cartoons originally featured innocent sexuality, visual puns and Classic Harlem Jazz aimed at an adult audience.  After the adoption of the Hays code in 1934, Betty became less than a shadow of her former self-- an old-fashioned housewife (without a husband) wearing a conservative dress and appealling to a juvenile audience.  This latter period marked the decline in the series and is the basis of this collection.  Really not worth the effort to watch, let alone buy it.
